newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tohoku Oil to restart desulphuriser in late March.
newsitem.headline: Tohoku Oil to restart desulphuriser in late March.

text.p: Tohoku Oil Co Ltd said on Wednesday that it plans to restart a 45,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) fuel oil desulphurisation unit at its Sendai refinery in late March. It has been shut since an accident in January.
A refinery official said the company would start a test run at the unit in northern Miyagi Prefecture on March 15. Commercial operations will begin on March 26 or 27, he added.

A fire broke out at the desulphuriser shortly after the newly installed unit started commercial operations on January 6. The unit is capable of cutting the sulphur content in heavy fuel oil to as low as 0.2 percent.

Tohoku Oil belongs to the Mitsubishi Oil group, and the accident resulted in a loss of about 1.5 to two billion yen for Mitsubishi Oil Co Ltd because it paid for the repair costs, and also because the closure forced Mitsubishi Oil to procure costly prompt low sulphur crude oil for Tohoku Oil, a Mitsubishi Oil spokesman said.
